column1: Undersampling has been widely used in the class-imbalance learning area. The main deficiency of most existing undersampling methods is that their data sampling strategies are heuristic-based and independent of the used classifier and evaluation metric. Thus
column2: they may discard informative instances for the classifier during the data sampling. In this work
column3: we propose a meta-learning method built on the undersampling to address this issue. The key idea of this method is to parametrize the data sampler and train it to optimize the classification performance over the evaluation metric. We solve the non-differentiable optimization problem for training the data sampler via reinforcement learning. By incorporating evaluation metric optimization into the data sampling process
column4: the proposed method can learn which instance should be discarded for the given classifier and evaluation metric. In addition
column6: this method can be easily applied to arbitrary evaluation metric and classifier
column8: C4.5 and KNN). Experimental results on both synthetic and realistic datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method.
